Key Arguments: The legislation will stifle free speech and innovation.
It poses a threat to democracy by potentially allowing only government-endorsed narratives.
The legislation could lead to overreach into private spaces and is unlikely to be reversed once implemented.
There is a concern about external influences on national narratives, threatening national sovereignty.
The proposed measures are seen as unnecessary for public safety and could hinder creativity and independent journalism.
The legislation is compared to dystopian scenarios, such as those depicted in '1984'.
The pandemic has shown the dangers of silencing counter-narratives.
Notable Quotes: Misinformation - disinformation are code words for legal blocking and preventing all criticism and free thought.
Are we entering the new dystopian era apparently predicted in the fiction book '1984', where the government has a 'Ministry of Truth'?
Truly, laws such as are being proposed are a move back into dark days of ignorance and silence.
